item.title: Laura add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Laura add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Laura add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Laura add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Laura add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Laura add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Laura add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Laura add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Laura add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Laura add a quote by James Michener
item.description: "I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions." -- James Michener

item.title: Laura add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Laura add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "My task, which I am trying to achieve is, by the power of the written word, to make you hear, to make you feel--it is, before all, to make you see." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Laura add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "A good poem is a contribution to reality. The world is never the same once a good poem has been added to it. A good poem helps to change the shape of the universe, helps to extend everyone's knowledge of himself and the world around him." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Laura add a quote by Paul Valery
item.description: "Poems are never finished - just abandoned" -- Paul Valery

item.title: Laura add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"the writing of some men is like a vast bridge that carries you over the many things that claw and tear.
The Wine of Forever" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Laura add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "All words are pegs to hang ideas on." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Laura add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "A young writer is easily tempted by the allusive and ethereal and ironic and reflective, but the declarative is at the bottom of most good writing." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Laura add a quote by Steve Shilstone
item.description: "The thing I write will be the thing I write." -- Steve Shilstone
